result.reason: Highly requested feature (20+ community comments over 5 years) to support Windows native OpenSSH as an alternative SSH backend to PuTTY, reducing external dependencies and improving integration
result.approach: Add a new OpenSSH protocol backend that launches Windows native ssh.exe (C:\Windows\System32\OpenSSH\ssh.exe) embedded in a ConPTY/pseudo-terminal control, as an alternative to PuttyBase. Requires new SSHOpenSSH protocol class, terminal emulator control (eg ConPTY via Windows.Terminal or embedded conhost), and a user-facing setting to choose SSH backend (PuTTY vs OpenSSH). Major architectural work - SSH1/SSH2 currently inherit PuttyBase directly.

Major architectural work - SSH1/SSH2 currently inherit PuttyBase directly."}
